page.title: 08The Blue Lake
page.content: The Blue Lake was formed in 1933 when diggers in the area hit natural springs 14 feet below the water table. A lake was formed overnight. It was 33 feet deep in the shallowest end and 38 feet deep in the deepest. Previously, there had been a Saxon cemetery on the site. This was accidentally discovered by men excavating for chalk. The lake became polluted in 1974 when the bearings on the kilns in the cement factory broke down, and instead of pumping out water they pumped out crude oil into the lake. The owners, Blue Circle Cement Works, have put the lake to many uses. These include a fishing lake, a water supply to the factory and an emergency reservoir for water in a bad drought. Many people have lost their lives by drowning or committing suicide in the lake.
